name: PyCite APA
tagline: An easy citation creator for APA books, websites, newspapers, journals, and more.
body:
### Welcome to PyCite, created by Hoegen Developments
This citation created takes user inputted information and spits out a APA citation, that can be used for any papers.




Supports citations for:
```
Websites
Books
Newspapers
Academic Journals
```
![](http://slimgur.com/images/2015/06/14/736587090c0461824edf320bcfd202ec.png)
### Instructions
Download the .zip file to begin, then unzip it and click on PyCite APA Free.exe to begin citations.
# Saving Citations
To save citations, you can copy and paste it from the console by right clicking on the title bar of the application and 
hovering over 'edit' and selecting 'mark'

From there, you can highlight your citation and hit enter on your clipboard to copy it.
### Contact
Visit http://www.hoegndevelopments.ga for more information, more features will be added soon.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
